labels.analysis: The MCP Server "BrowserCat Remote Browser Automation" is designed to enable language models to automate web browsing tasks through a cloud-based browser service. It provides tools for navigating web pages, interacting with elements (clicking, filling forms, selecting options), taking screenshots, executing JavaScript, and monitoring console logs. This functionality allows users to perform web-based tasks programmatically without relying on a local browser installation, making it ideal for web scraping, automated testing, and dynamic web interactions.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Browser Automation" is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around automating web browsing tasks, including navigation, element interaction, and JavaScript execution. The secondary label "Web Search & Research" is included because the tools can be used for gathering information and research. The server's capability to execute JavaScript and capture screenshots also aligns with data processing, hence the secondary label "Data Analysis & Processing." No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the server's functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: BrowserCat Remote Browser Automation
server_info_crawled.author: @pipethedev/browsercat-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable LLMs to automate web browsing tasks remotely using BrowserCat's cloud browser service. Interact with web pages by navigating, clicking, filling forms, taking screenshots, and executing JavaScript without local browser installation. Monitor console logs and capture screenshots seamlessly for enhanced web interaction workflows.

tools.name: browsercat_navigate
tools.description: Deploy Server BrowserCat Remote Browser Automation @pipethedev/browsercat-mcp-server Try in Playground browsercat_navigate

tools.name: browsercat_screenshot
tools.description: Take a screenshot of the current page or a specific element

tools.name: browsercat_click
tools.description: Click an element on the page

tools.name: browsercat_select
tools.description: Select an option from a dropdown menu

tools.name: browsercat_hover
tools.description: Hover over an element on the page

tools.name: browsercat_evaluate
tools.description: Execute JavaScript in the browser console

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@pipethedev/browsercat-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
